text.0: thou agni who wilt have the strong hast made me the somas priest to worship in assembly.
text.1: thou shinest to the gods i set the pressstones i toil be joyful in thyself o agni.
text.2: east have we turned the rite may the hymn aid it with wood and worship shall they honour agni.
text.3: from heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it een for the quick and strong they seek advancement.
text.4: the prudent he whose will is pure brought welfare allied by birth to heaven and earth in kinship.
text.5: the gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful agni with the sisters labour.
text.6: him blessed one the seven strong floods augmented him white at birth and red when waxen mighty.
text.7: as mother mares run to their newborn you ling so at his birth the gods wondered at agni.
text.8: spreading with radiant limbs throughout the region purging his power with wise purifications.
text.9: robing himself in light the life of waters he spreads abroad his high and perfect glories.
text.10: he sought heavens mighty ones the unconsuming the unimpaired not clothed and yet not naked.
text.11: then they ancient and young who dwell together seven sounding rivers as one germ received him.
text.12: his piles assuming every form are scattered where flow sweet waters at the spring of fatness.
text.13: there stood the milchkine with fullladen udders and both paired mighty mothers of the wondrous.
text.14: carefully cherished son of strength thou shoncst assuming lasting and refulgent beauties.
text.15: full streams of fatness and sweet juice descended there where the mighty one grew strong by wisdom.
text.16: from birth he knew even his fathers bosom he set his voices and his streams in motion.
text.17: knew him who moved with blessed friends in secret with the young dames of heaven he stayed not hidden.
text.18: he nursed the infant of the sire and maker alone the babe sucked many a teeming bosom.
text.19: guard for the bright and strong the fellowspouses friendly to men and bound to him in kinship.
text.20: the mighty one increased in space unbounded full many a glorious flood gave strength to agni.
text.21: friend of the house within the lap of order lay agni in the sister rivers service.
text.22: as keen supporter where great waters gather lightshedder whom the brood rejoice to look on.
text.23: he who begat and will beget the dawnlights most manly child of floods is youthful agni.
text.24: him varied in his form the lovely infant of floods and plants the blessed wood hath gendered.
text.25: gods even moved in spirit came around him and served him at his birth the strong the wondrous.
text.26: like brilliant lightnings mighty luminaries accompany the lightdiffusing agni.
text.27: waxen as twere in secret in his dwelling while in the boundless stall they milk out amṛta.
text.28: i sacrificing serve thee with oblations and crave with longing thy goodwill and friendship.
text.29: grant with the gods thy grace to him who lauds thee protect us with thy rays that guard the homestead.
text.30: may we o agni thou who leadest wisely thy followers and masters of all treasures.
text.31: strong in the glory of our noble offspring subdue the godless when they seek the battle.
text.32: ensign of gods hast thou become o agni joygiver knower of all secret wisdom.
text.33: friend of the homestead thou hast lightened mortals carborne thou goest to the gods fulfilling.
text.34: within the house hath sate the king immortal of mortals filling full their sacred synods.
text.35: bedewed with holy oil he shineth widely agni the knower of all secret wisdom.
text.36: come unto us with thine auspicious friendship come speeding mighty with thy mighty succours.
text.37: grant us abundant wealth that saves from danger that brings a good repute a glorious portion.
text.38: to thee who art of old these songs o agni have i declared the ancient and the later.
text.39: these great libations to the strong are offiered in every birth is jātavedas stablished.
text.40: stablished in every birth is jātavedas kindled perpetual by the viśvāmitras.
text.41: may we rest ever in the lovingkindness in the auspicious grace of him the holy.
text.42: this sacrifice of ours do thou o mighty o truly wise bear to the gods rejoicing.
text.43: grant us abundant food thou priestly herald vouchsafe to give us ample wealth o agni.
text.44: as holy food agni to thineinvoker give wealth in cattle lasting rich in marvels.
text.45: to us he born a son and spreading offspring agni be this thy gracious will to usward.
